name: ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Ground Anchor
template name: ITP - Waikare Gorge Descent - C1603A - Ground Anchor

name: Detail - Location of the tests (to be agreed with the Engineer, two tests shall be completed), and 1 pull test location.
Frequency - At least 1 week prior to Testing
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Inspection
Conformance Criteria - Consistency with Construction Drawing and agreed with Engineer
Detail - Any services in the area are to be clearly marked before any work commence.
Frequency - At least 1 week prior to Testing
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Service location
Conformance Criteria - Service location conducted by asset owner, marked out with dazzle on site.
Records - Asset owner report, site inspection
○ Anchor rod diameter: minimum 25mm threaded bar, with a minimum yield strength of 500 Mpa
Frequency - At least 1 week prior to Testing
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Design Working Load (DWL) per Anchor: 168kN
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition

Detail - The steel structural sections for the Waler assemblies shall be primed with ethyl silicate or alkali silicate zinc rich primer in accordance with AS/NZS 4680, ASNZS 2312 Part 1 Paint Coatings and NZTA S9 respectively.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - AS/NZS 3679.1, AS/NZS 4680, ASNZS 2312 Part 1
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition

Detail - The Contractor shall provide the engineer with test certificates giving the tensile and yield strengths of the steel used to manufacture the structural steels and steel plates at least seven days prior to the fabrication of waler.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Test certificates of tensile and yield strengths, 7 days prior to installation, 150 mm x 75 mm PFC WALER BEAM
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - 150 mm x 75 mm PFC WALER BEAM
Detail - Bearing plates shall be steel with a minimum yield strength of 350MPa and the final size and thickness shall be confirmed by the Contractor in conjunction with the anchor supplier.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - minimum yield strength of 350MPa
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
9 - Hex nut/ Washer Plate Material Compliance
Detail - Shall be standard, heavy-duty, high strength, structural quality only, flat base, machined from steel, designed for use with the all-threaded anchor rod.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - conforming to Grade AS/NZS 1252
○ Develop more than 125% of the yield strength of the anchor rod & ultimate strength of not less than 100% of the guaranteed ultimate tensile strength
○ Hex nut/washer shall be hot dipped galvanised.
Detail - Mechanical couplings, when required, may be used to splice the anchors.
○ The couplings shall be stainless steel and wrapped in Denso Tape to satisfy double corrosion protection requirements.
○ Grub screws or locknuts shall be installed and mechanically tightened either side of the mechanical couple
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, Inspection
Conformance Criteria - 100% of the guaranteed ultimate tensile strength of the anchor rod
○ Certified mill test results from each heat specifying the ultimate strength, yield strength, elongation, and composition
Detail - The Contractor shall submit a construction plan and detailed construction sequence to the Engineer at least 1 week to commencing pull-out testing
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Document outlining Start date, working drawings, methods, manufacturer certificates, detailed construction sequence
Detail - The contractor needs to supply working drawings which outline the details and location of the pull out tests
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
○ Location of the tests (approved by CPS)
13 - Anchor Construction Submittals - Ground Anchor Schedule
Detail - The contractor needs to supply a ground anchor schedule which outlines the strength and detailing requirements:
○ Ground anchor capacity reduction factors for rod & pull-out
○ Type and size of anchor rod;
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Anchor submittal Document outlining strength and detailing meets specification
Detail - Details of the jacking frame and appurtenant bracing.
○ Identification number and certified calibration records for each test jack and pressure gauge and
○ load cell to be used. Calibration records to include the date tested, device identification number, and the calibration test results and shall be
○ conducted by a qualified independent testing laboratory within forty-five (45) working days prior to submittal
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Anchor submittal Document outlining strength and detailing meets specification
○ Certified for an accuracy of at least 2 percent of the applied certification loads

Detail - Testing equipment shall include dial gauges, dial gauge support, jack and pressure gauge, electronic load cell, and a reaction frame. Contractor shall provide the description to the Engineer prior to testing.
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - description of test setup and jack, pressure gauge and load cell calibration curves
Detail - The testing reaction frame shall be sufficiently rigid and of adequate dimensions such that excessive deformation of the testing equipment does not occur.
Frequency - One week prior to install
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Reaction frame sufficiently rigid
○ Support and centre jackover anchor rod
○ Jack, bearing plates and stressing anchorage aligned with rod to as not require repositioning during test
Records - Anchor Test log, photos, submittal doc

Detail - Test load shall use hydraulic jack and pressure gauge. The pressure gauge shall be graduated in 500 kPa increments or less. The jack and pressure gauge shall have a pressure range not exceeding twice the anticipated maximum test pressure.
○ Monitor the anchor load during the pull-out test with both the pressure gauge and the load cell. Use the load cell to maintain constant load during the creep test portion of the pull-out test.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review, visual inspections
Conformance Criteria - Jack and pressure gauge shall have a pressure range within requirements
Records - Anchor testing submittal, Anchor testing log
Detail - Measure the anchor head movement with a dial gauge capable of measuring to 0.025 mm. Use two dial gauges when the test setup requires reaction against a soil cut face.
Conformance Criteria - Gauge capable of 0.025mm used
○ Visually aligned gauge parallel with axis of anchor
○ Two gauges used during reaction against a soil cut face
Records - Visual inspection, photos, Anchor testing log
19 - Anchor Construction Submittals - Ground anchor report

Detail - As-built drawings showing the location and orientation of each ground anchor, anchor capacity, total anchor length as installed. Ground anchor test results, graphs and supporting interpretation
Frequency - within twenty (20) calendar days after completing installation
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document review
Conformance Criteria - Ground anchor report sent to engineer within twenty (20) calendar days containing:
Detail - store steel and accessories without damage or contamination. All materials shall be stored on timber pallets on hard ground in a secure area, clear of any construction operations.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - inspection
Conformance Criteria - Stored on timber pallets
Detail - Anchor components incorporated in the wall shall be free of corrosion and physical damage at the time of placement
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - inspection
Conformance Criteria - Free of corrosion and physical damage, Placed so will not damage ground

Detail - Works shall be carried out in accordance with NZGS (2023) Ground Anchors: Design and Construction Guideline. Should any discrepancies between the relevant codes and standards contained in the above Guideline and this Specification arise, they shall be brought to the attention of the Engineer
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - inspection
Conformance Criteria - NZGS (2023) Ground Anchors: Design and Construction Guideline
Detail - Anchors shall be installed at an angle within ±2 degrees of the angle of the theoretical centreline and shall be located horizontally on the face of the wall accurately
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual inspection
Conformance Criteria - Angle within ±2 degrees of the angle of the theoretical centreline plus or minus 25 mm from the position shown on the drawings.

Detail - No-load greater than 10% of the design load can be applied to the ground anchor prior to testing. The maximum test load shall not exceed 80% of the specified minimum ultimate tensile strength of the anchor rod.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Visual inspection,
Conformance Criteria - Pull-Out Test Schedule <80% min ULT load
Detail - Pull-out testing shall be carried out on one sacrificial ground anchor, The pull-out test shall be done at a location and elevation agreed and approved by the Engineer.
Frequency - Prior to installation of anchors
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Conducted prior to installation, Location approved by CPS Engineer
Records - Pull out test log, Submittal

Detail - The pull-out test shall be carried out to 150% of the Design Working Load (DWL) and the contractor shall supply a larger anchor rod (if required) to safely accommodate the maximum test load. Anchor movements during the Creep Test shall be measured and recorded.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Refer to the Pull out test schedule
○ Maintained within 2% of the intended load
Detail - The alignment load (AL) should not exceed 5% of the DWL. Dial gauges should be set to zero after the alignment load has been applied.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - AL not exceed 5% of the DWL
Detail - The results of the pull-out test, along with calculations and their interpretation shall be forwarded to the Engineer
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Engineer to send through approval within 48 hours of receiving results
30 - Ground Anchors - Proof Testing of Anchors
Detail - The proof tests shall incrementally load each ground anchor in accordance with the Proof Test Loading Schedule and in conjunction with the specifications 5.7.3.3
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Proof testing completed on two anchors as selected by the Engineer

Detail - The maximum test load in a proof test shall maintain a constant load. The load-hold period shall start as soon as the maximum test load is applied and the ground anchor movement with respect to a fixed reference shall be measured
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - recorded at 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 10 minutes. If creep test up to 10 minutes exceeds 1 mm, the maximum test load shall be held for an additional 50 minutes
Detail - The remaining anchors should also be tested to the same methodology up to 1.00 of the DWL unless approved otherwise by the Engineer.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - testing, measure
Conformance Criteria - Total movement within the 10 minute hold is less than 1 mm between 1 and 10 minutes.
Detail - Survey final position and R.L. of each anchor, produce As-Built drawings
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Measurement / Survey
Detail - Ensure all NCRs are closed and included within QA file, Delivery Dockets and Lab Testing Spreadsheet and Test Reports to be included in QA File
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all QA is uploaded into ConQA / Procore
Records - Delivery Dockets, Test Reports, Lab Testing Register
Detail - Check all anchor records are completed and signed by the relevant signatory.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Document Review
Detail - Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
Frequency - At the completion of the Lot of work
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Drawings
